subs.text: @rationalwalk @stratechery Interesting that the two came out on the same day. Hope @benthompson comments on The Atlantic article in an update. Would separating social graphs from timeline algorithms and APIs help?

subs.text: @zamishka @barttels2 My reading was that US democracy functioned for so long because of systems created to temper mass man’s worst instincts. Systems which we’ve been short-circuiting for the last 10+ years. So yes, it’s a core problem in a way water being wet is a core problem of needing an umbrella
subs.rawText: @zamishka @barttels2 My reading was that US democracy functioned for so long because of systems created to temper mass man’s worst instincts. Systems which we’ve been short-circuiting for the last 10+ years. So yes, it’s a core problem in a way water being wet is a core problem of needing an umbrella

subs.text: @zamishka @barttels2 Why do you say that? Most of America isn’t on Twitter, and most Twitter users aren’t part of pileups. I must have misunderstood what you meant by “mass men”.
subs.rawText: @zamishka @barttels2 Why do you say that? Most of America isn’t on Twitter, and most Twitter users aren’t part of pileups. I must have misunderstood what you meant by “mass men”.

subs.text: @zamishka @barttels2 Why are mass man’s motives the core problem rather than non-mass people’s (“the exhausted majority”’s) reaction to the mass? The article had some sensible suggestions on how to improve things. A bit more pie-in-the-sky but still good is today’s Stratechery [link]
subs.rawText: @zamishka @barttels2 Why are mass man’s motives the core problem rather than non-mass people’s (“the exhausted majority”’s) reaction to the mass? The article had some sensible suggestions on how to improve things. A bit more pie-in-the-sky but still good is today’s Stratechery https://t.co/MYQkLhXutl

subs.text: Frustrating to listen. Yes, well-done RCTs are prohibitively expensive and many good ideas are box-checked to death. The solution isn’t to ration RCTs, but to make them less costly (and not just in money) 🎙 [link]
subs.rawText: Frustrating to listen. Yes, well-done RCTs are prohibitively expensive and many good ideas are box-checked to death. The solution isn’t to ration RCTs, but to make them less costly (and not just in money) 🎙 https://t.co/gsB28YuMTe

🧪 Good morning to everyone except to whomever is in charge of the eRA Commons service desk. You’d think that a multi-billion dollar operation like NIH would have a decent answering service, with a call-back option, number in line, etc.
